get.description:
This endpoint returns the complete list of academic events available
in the system.

200.description: Returns the list of academic events.

requestBody.description: The academic event to be created.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific academic event by its identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the academic event.

404.description: If the academic event does not exist.

put.description:
The identifier in the route must match the identifier of the academic
event provided in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the academic event.

200.description: The academic event was updated successfully.

400.description: If the route identifier does not match the payload.

404.description: If the academic event does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the academic event.

204.description: The academic event was deleted successfully.

404.description: If the academic event does not exist.

put.summary: Subscribes the authenticated user to an academic event.

403.description: If the user is not authorized.

404.description: If the event does not exist.

put.summary: Unsubscribes the authenticated user from an academic event.

403.description: If the user is not authorized.

404.description: If the event or subscription does not exist.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new user account using the provided registration details.
If the email address is already in use, the operation fails.

400.description: If the provided password does not meet validation rules.

409.description: If an account with the given email already exists.

post.summary: Authenticates a user using email and password.
post.description:
If authentication succeeds, a JSON Web Token (JWT) is issued and returned
to the client. The token must be included in subsequent requests to
authenticate the user.

401.description: If the provided credentials are invalid.

post.summary: Logs out the currently authenticated user.
post.description: This endpoint terminates the current authentication session.

401.description: If the request is not authenticated.

delete.description:
Only users with the `User` role may delete their own accounts.
The operation signs the user out before account deletion.

parameters.name: userEmail
parameters.description: The email address of the account to delete.

403.description: If the user does not have permission to perform this action.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new user account and assigns the Manager role.
Only administrators are authorized to perform this operation.

delete.description: Only administrators are allowed to delete manager accounts.

parameters.name: ManagerEmail
parameters.description: The email address of the manager to delete.

404.description: If the manager does not exist.

400.description: If the email address is not provided.

put.summary: Updates the status of an event request.
put.description:
This endpoint allows an administrator to review an existing event request
and update its status. It is used to approve or reject requests submitted
by managers for the creation, modification, or deletion of academic events.

requestBody.description:
The request containing the identifier of the event request and the new status
to be applied. The status must be set to either `Approved` or `Rejected`.

200.description: The event request status was updated successfully.

400.description: If the provided request data is invalid or the status value is not supported.

403.description: If the authenticated user does not have administrative privileges.

404.description: If the specified event request does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves event requests based on the role of the authenticated user.
get.description:
Role-based behavior:
- Admin: retrieves all event requests in the system.
- Manager: retrieves only event requests created by the authenticated manager.

200.description: Returns the list of event requests.

post.description:
Only managers are allowed to create event requests.
The newly created request is initially assigned a default status.

201.description: Returns the newly created event request.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific event request by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event request.

404.description: If the event request does not exist or is not accessible.

get.summary: Retrieves event requests associated with a specific faculty.
get.description:
Intended primarily for administrative use to filter event requests
belonging to a particular faculty.

parameters.name: facultyId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the faculty.

200.description: Returns the filtered list of event requests.

put.summary: Updates the status of an existing event request.
put.description:
Only administrators are allowed to update event request statuses.
Typical status transitions include approval or rejection.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event request.

400.description: If the request ID does not match the payload.

404.description: If the event request does not exist.

delete.description: Managers may only delete event requests they created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event request.

404.description: If the event request does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves all personal events belonging to the authenticated user.
get.description:
This endpoint returns only the events owned by the currently logged-in user.
The user identifier is derived from the authentication context and not
from client input.

403.description: You don't have permission to perform this action

200.description: Returns the list of personal events.

post.summary: Creates a new personal event for the authenticated user.
post.description:
The created event is automatically associated with the current user.
Clients do not provide user identifiers directly.

403.description: You don't have permission to perform this action

201.description: Returns the newly created personal event.

get.summary: Retrieves all personal events belonging to the authenticated user.
get.description:
This endpoint returns only the events owned by the currently logged-in user.
The user identifier is derived from the authentication context and not
from client input.

403.description: You don't have permission to perform this action

200.description: Returns the list of personal events.

put.description:
The authenticated user may only update events they own.
Attempts to update events owned by other users will result in a forbidden response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event.

403.description: If the event does not belong to the authenticated user.

400.description: If the event identifier does not match the payload.

404.description: If the event does not exist.

delete.description: The authenticated user may only delete events they own.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event.

403.description: If the event does not belong to the authenticated user.

404.description: If the event does not exist.
